Since then, we haven’t seen any open, full-fledged wars, not because there have been no tensions among the countries and we all are living happily, but because of the reason that most of the developed and developing countries have nuclear arms.

Conclusion: We should abolish the National Register of Citizens (NRC)
Premise: The NRC body and the Foreign Tribunals in Assam are functioning behind the curtains and its functioning is clearly signaling toward the ruling party’s agenda of getting rid of Minorities. Earlier retired judges were carefully selected for Foreign Tribunals but now any lawyer who is above 50 on 25 April 2015 and has 10 years of experience can volunteer for FT and gets a seat. Various online sources have reported that the FT is full of people sharing the ruling party’s ideology and are asked to perform well.

Conclusion: Indian government should increase the minimum legal age of marriage for girls from 18 to 21 years
Premise: Early marriages result in several mental health issues in many girls. So, this move can eliminate this problem.

Conclusion: Cattle slaughter should be banned
Premise: The cow is a sacred animal for Hindus. Killing cows hurts their sentiments.

Conclusion: We should stop subsidies and other incentives for bioenergy
Premise: Fossil-sourced natural gas is as harmful as coal or oil. If it is sourced from fossil fuels, natural gas produces a net increase in CO2 in the atmosphere when burned.

Conclusion: We should invest in sustainable alternative fuels for aviation
Premise: Sustainable alternative fuels allow emission reductions of up to 80%.

Conclusion: We should invest in nuclear energy
Premise: Nuclear energy is undoubtedly the best form of electricity production, massive and controllable, with no CO²/GHG emissions.

Conclusion: We should limit the number of plastic types used for packaging

Conclusion: We should improve migration policies
Premise: The only meaningful immigration is when there is a member country with a specific vacancy. That member will also be responsible for the integration (at a cost of Euro 167,000). The EU has only to administer the paperwork and supervise if matters spin out of control.

Conclusion: We should make pushbacks legal
Premise: Pushbacks may not be a nice way of operating. However, Brussels is causing problems by telling the whole World that everyone (7 billion people) has the right to apply for asylum in the EU.  It would be much better by refusing admission to anyone appearing at the border without papers.  The experience is that over 80% of the immigrants are not refugees in danger.

Conclusion: We should preserve European culture
Premise: Multiculturalism will enhance our society.

Conclusion: We should stop destabilizing developing countries by subsidized agricultural exports
Premise: Please consider this: right now in Africa several million people are half starved, and eat a meal a day at best. They live thanks to cheap agricultural products coming from Europe, because local stuff is too expensive for them.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non first-world countries
Premise: Saying no to any migration is just stupid and irrealistic.

Conclusion: We should stop making one-cent coins
Premise: A one-cent coin costs about 60% more to produce than it is actually worth.

Conclusion: We should reduce subsidies for livestock and fisheries

Conclusion: We should remove unauthorized asylum seekers and migrants
Premise: All people have the same right to be here. Nobody is unjustified. Refugees/migrants are not to be expelled, certainly not immediately, but to be included in the employment problems and economic situation.

Conclusion: We should support Frontex.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries

Conclusion: We should strengthen our ties with Ukraine and prepare for its membership in the EU
Premise: When you see young Ukrainians dying for the EU and its values during Euromaidan, you have no choice but to accept that Ukraine has chosen Europe. Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: Recording precise data of individuals can improve individual lives; recording huge data of groups can optimize resource allocation.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: In the event of a cloud data loss or data breach, the data cannot be recovered.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.

Conclusion: We should open up three-child policy to encourage childbirth.

Conclusion: We should prohibit capital monopoly.

Conclusion: We should vigorously develop the countryside.
Premise: Unemployment and urbanization when combined are slums and instability, so the rural areas need to be allowed to absorb the unemployed.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.
Premise: No one can stop global warming, which is inherently part of the Earth's geological cycle. That's why topics such as reducing CO2 emissions are a false proposition.
